title: Why fears of a trillion-dollar AI bubble are growing
summary: Tech firms are spending hundreds of billions of dollars on advanced chips and data centers, not just to keep pace with a surge in the use of chatbots such as ChatGPT, Gemini and Claude, but to make sure they’re ready to handle a more fundamental and disruptive shift of economic activity from humans to machines.  Since then, other tech rivals have ramped up spending, including Meta’s Mark Zuckerberg, who has pledged to invest hundreds of billions in data centers.

title: Magnificent Seven surpass EU GDP: Is this a tech bubble warning?
summary: The combined market value of the US 'Magnificent Seven' tech giants has surpassed the EU’s GDP, raising concerns of a tech bubble. While valuations are high, comparisons to the dot-com era suggest this may be a structural shift.View on euronews

title: Stock Of The Day, Key Supplier For Meta And Microsoft, Climbs To Record High
summary: Constellation Energy is the IBD Stock of the Day after the clean-energy provider broke out above a buy point Wednesday.  Constellation is the nation's largest producer of carbon-free energy.  The company says 90% of its capacity is carbon-free energy, or about 10% of the total U.S. clean-energy supply.

title: Microsoft's Least Exciting Business Line Is Its Most Important, and Investors Shouldn't Overlook It
summary: "Boring" products can make for revenue that funds riskier bets.

title: Palantir Rebuts Report on Security Flaws After Stock Falls
summary: The report on Friday, published by Reuters, centered on a September Army memo expressing concerns over Anduril’s NGC2 prototype system, which stands for Next Generation Command and Control, and includes subcontractors Palantir and Microsoft Corp. A representative for Palantir said that, “No vulnerabilities were found in the Palantir platform.”  In a statement, the Army’s chief information officer also said the problems with the NGC2 system were “identified early and mitigated immediately,” and that the issues were fixed in a controlled testing environment.  Friday’s share move was the biggest decline for Palantir since August, and the stock was the worst S&P 500 performer for the day.

title: Anduril and Palantir battlefield communication system 'very high risk,' US Army memo says
summary: WASHINGTON (Reuters) -The much-needed modernization of the U.S. Army's battlefield communications network being undertaken by Anduril, Palantir and others is rife with "fundamental security" problems and vulnerabilities, and should be treated as a "very high risk," according to a recent internal Army memo.  The two Silicon Valley companies, led by allies of U.S. President Donald Trump, have gained access to the Pentagon's lucrative flow of contracts on the promise of quickly providing less expensive and more sophisticated weapons than the Pentagon's longstanding arms providers.

title: 3 reasons to buy Microsoft & avoid Adobe
summary: Carnegie Investment Counsel portfolio manager Ben Connard joins Market Domination host Josh Lipton on this episode of Good Buy or Goodbye to share his top and bottom stock picks: Microsoft (MSFT) and Adobe (ADBE), respectively, giving three reasons for both calls. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination.

title: 'Elon Is Smart And Ahead Of The Curve,' Says Mark Cuban, But Still Doesn't Think Humanoid Robots Are The Future
summary: Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) CEO Elon Musk claimed in May that humanoid robots will begin impacting GDP in just four to five years. But while billionaire Mark Cuban agrees Musk is forward-thinking when it comes to video-based robotics, he isn't sold on humanoid robots being the game-changer everyone thinks they'll be. title: Tech Industry Groups Push Back on Trump’s $100,000 H-1B Visa Fee
summary: A coalition of tech industry groups sent a letter to President Trump urging him to reconsider a new $100,000 fee for H-1B holders, arguing that the policy shift would hurt the U.S. in the artificial-intelligence race.  The new fee is testing the relationship between the tech industry and the White House after many executives have increased their U.S. spending and appealed to Trump.

title: Goldman says AWS strength underappreciated, raises Amazon price target
summary: Investing.com -- Goldman Sachs reiterated Amazon.com as a top pick ahead of third-quarter earnings, saying that investors are underestimating the growth and profit potential of its cloud computing unit, Amazon Web Services (AWS).

title: ​AI Chatbots Move Toward a Future With Advertising and Online Shopping
summary: As AI expenditures mount, Meta, OpenAI and other AI firms have little choice but to expand their monetization efforts. Get ready for ads in your chatbots.

title: BlackRock Group Hunts a $20 Billion Deal to Get In on the AI Boom
summary: BlackRock’s  new artificial-intelligence infrastructure consortium is close to an agreement to acquire Aligned Data Centers for about $20 billion, people familiar with the matter said.  Launched last year by BlackRock,  Microsoft  and Mubadala Investment Co.’s MGX, the Global AI Infrastructure Investment Partnership intends to raise $100 billion in equity and debt to invest in and expand a network of data centers used by AI giants.  A deal with Aligned, which is valued at $40 billion including debt, would be the first bite and could come together by early next week, the people said.

title: Magnificent Seven Member Nvidia Stock Breaks Out, Is Actionable Now
summary: Nvidia, maker of the high-powered chips needed in AI, is trading inside a 5% buy zone from a breakout this week.

title: The Magnificent Seven Stocks Are Roaring Again. Can They Keep Climbing?
summary: After lagging the S&P 500's gains for most of 2025, the Magnificent 7 recently overtook the benchmark index to reclaim its lead.

title: Analysts Keep Raising Price Targets for Microsoft Stock - MSFT is Still Cheap
summary: Analysts are continuing to raise Microsoft's price targets ahead of earnings results. As a result, MSFT stock is moving up. Shorting out-of-the-money puts and buying in-the-money calls look attractive.

title: Activision officials must face claims over Microsoft takeover, judge rules
summary: (Reuters) -A Delaware judge said former Activision Blizzard officials including Chief Executive Bobby Kotick must face most of a lawsuit alleging they shortchanged shareholders when Microsoft bought the "Call of Duty" game maker for $75.4 billion.  Chancellor Kathaleen McCormick of the Delaware Chancery Court said on Thursday the shareholders in the proposed class action can pursue their "core" claim that Kotick and other Activision directors breached their fiduciary duties.
